metadata.title: CVE-2017-5844 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
The gst_riff_create_audio_caps function in gst-libs/gst/riff/riff-media.cin gst-plugins-base in GStreamer before 1.10.3 allows remote attackers tocause a denial of service (floating point exception and crash) via acrafted ASF file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5844` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-gst-plugins-base-0.10 - 0.10.36-2ubuntu0.1
gstreamer0.10-alsa - 0.10.36-2ubuntu0.1
gstreamer0.10-gnomevfs - 0.10.36-2ubuntu0.1
gstreamer0.10-plugins-base - 0.10.36-2ubuntu0.1
gstreamer0.10-plugins-base-apps - 0.10.36-2ubuntu0.1
gstreamer0.10-x - 0.10.36-2ubuntu0.1
libgstreamer-plugins-base0.10-0 - 0.10.36-2ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

gir1.2-gst-plugins-base-1.0 - 1.8.3-1ubuntu0.2
gstreamer1.0-alsa - 1.8.3-1ubuntu0.2
gstreamer1.0-plugins-base - 1.8.3-1ubuntu0.2
gstreamer1.0-plugins-base-apps - 1.8.3-1ubuntu0.2
gstreamer1.0-x - 1.8.3-1ubuntu0.2
libgstreamer-plugins-base1.0-0 - 1.8.3-1ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gst-plugins-base0.10 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.10.36-2ubuntu0.1').
gst-plugins-base1.0 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.8.3-1ubuntu0.2').
